Description

Jr. Accounting Software Writer  (Remote Friendly)

Your role in a nutshell: The Jr. Accounting Software Writer will be an integral part of building the most comprehensive small business accounting and bookkeeping portal on the internet.

This position includes:
  • The Jr. Accounting Software Writer will be writing in-depth comparison articles of accounting, bookkeeping, and tax software.
  • Researching (including interviewing experts and participating in demos) and writing articles about specialty software and apps.
  • Updating product features and pricing information. 
  • Providing detailed responses to reader questions.
  • Developing infographics and visuals to support written content.
Our mission:To deliver the best answers to people's questions.
Recently named to the Inc. 500 list of America’s fastest-growing private companies, Fit Small Business has more than 3 million small business owners and managers reading our content each month. We deliver well-researched, authoritative articles so these owners can make informed decisions to grow businesses that fuel the economy. Our founders have built successful businesses before, and FSB is profitable with no outside funding. Part of the team of 170+ people is in our NYC headquarters, near Grand Central. Others are distributed across the U.S., Canada, and the Philippines.
Does this sound like you?
  • As the new Jr. Accounting Software Writer you will have a professional or educational background in bookkeeping and accounting. 
  • You’re excited about the ways software and other technology can create efficiencies for small businesses and provide them with new insights. 
  • You are passionate about writing and want to share your knowledge in written form to teach our eager readership how to make their small businesses succeed.
Your Background:
  • At least one year of relevant experience.
  • Strong working knowledge of common accounting software, like QuickBooks. 
  • You enjoy learning the ins and outs of software and apps. 
  • You are a great researcher and writer.
  • You are high energy, and passionate about helping small businesses.
  • You are comfortable working in a startup environment, where things change quickly.
  • You have a strong work ethic.

WordPress, Insightly, G Suite, Slack, Trello, Guru, Zoom
*It's ok if you have not used these, just be enthusiastic to learn them.

Job description

Who we are

We are a team of passionate and intellectually diverse individuals, who are building financial services that help companies grow to their fullest potential. We believe that fast, fair, and equitable access to financial intelligence can level the playing field for high performing and high potential companies at any stage in their financing.

The Capital Machine is a systematic financial analysis tool that functions like Bloomberg, but for private companies. Private companies connect their data to the machine and receive financing offers within hours from Capital’s balance sheet. On the back-end, the machine analyzes and benchmarks company data, facilitating data-driven engagement between those who invest capital and those who need it to scale their businesses.

What you’ll contribute

As an Analytics Engineer at Capital, you will work on mission-critical problems related to building robust, scalable data pipelines and productionizing analytics. You understand basic probability theory, applied machine learning, and textual analysis. You’re comfortable writing tested, performant code to migrate ideas from the workbench to production. You love visualization and get excited about making data beautiful and intuitively accessible to end users. At Capital, you’ll develop fluency in the language of capital markets and finance. You are an effective communicator who is excited to build bridges between members of these communities and your own.

Who you are

  • You have strong foundations in machine learning and probability theory, with demonstrated success working on applied challenges
  • You’ve mastered OOP in Python and have experience working on backend systems that are deployed to production environment
  • You understand fundamental software engineering concepts such as modularity, separation of concerns, data structures and interfaces, and computational complexity
  • You’ve implemented unit and functional testing as part of a continuous integration workflow
  • You have a good eye for data visualization and experience with static (e.g. ggplot2, Plotly) and dynamic (e.g. Dash, Bokeh) toolkits
  • You have solid written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to bridge the gap between those who do and don’t speak fluent “data”
  • You’ve worked with a distributed processing framework, such as spark, hive, or hadoop
  • You have experience implementing workflow/scheduling frameworks such as luigi or airflow
  • You have experience working on--or are interested in learning about and attacking--hard financial problems

How you'll be supported at Capital

  • Unlimited PTO and flexible WFH policy
  • Learning stipend to pursue any kind of professional development or continuing education related or not related to your field
  • Platinum medical, vision and dental coverage and OneMedical membership for you and your dependents. Includes FSA & HSA options
  • Unlimited parental leave plus fertility benefits
  • 401k plans and co-investment opportunities so you can be a part of Capital's stellar investment performance
  • Stipends for wellness, transportation, and electronics (laptops, headphones, monitors - anything you need to do your best work)
  • Stocked office with 24/7 access and custom workstations
  • Another request? Just let us know!
Apply now

About Capital

Capital is on a mission to make the $5 trillion private financial markets fair, transparent, and accessible to anyone who has an innovate idea and is seeking funding. Together, we are creating The Capital Machine to connect founders with investors.

The Capital Machine is a systematic financial analysis tool that functions like Bloomberg, but for private companies. Private companies connect their data to the machine and receive financing offers for complex $5 to 75 million transactions within hours. On the back-end, the machine analyzes and benchmarks company data. This enables it to select opportunities to hold in the Capital captive balance sheet entity and syndicate other opportunities across its network of institutional Capital partners.

Staff Accountant / Bookkeeper at Bookkeeping for Dentists LLC

Remote
ABOUT US:

Bookkeeping for Dentists LLC is a blend of custom software and super passionate people. We are a very tech savvy and modern bookkeeping firm specializing in dental practice benchmarking. We have over 100 clients whom we love and our #1 priority each day is the quality in our work. To achieve high quality, we utilize technology to the fullest and find ways to make every bookkeeping task as streamlined and automated as possible so we can focus on quality in our work and our relationships with clients.

POSITION WE NEED TO FILL:

With the immense growth this past year after developing our online web application, we need a personable Staff Accountant to assist with onboarding and cleaning up bookkeeping for new clients. Your primary function is to interface with potential and new clients as an onboarding accountant. You will be supporting them in the transition, answering bookkeeping related questions and helping new clients get started with us by gathering the items we need start, then you will be setting up and or cleaning-up their bookkeeping. We will train you in easy stages and taking new client calls will be the last stage, so don’t be nervous, you’ll be a pro by then.

ROOM TO GROW:

There is room for growth in this position. You could be our onboarding accountant forever, or you can later head into other roles as we quickly grow. The choice is yours.

SPECIFICS:

The position is 100% remote (work from home) because our entire team is also 100% remote. You will be working directly under the founder, 40 hours per week. Health insurance and 401k benefits are also provided.

IMPORTANT QUALIFICATIONS (Read Carefully):
  • You MUST be SUPER personable with both email and phone calls.
  • You must be an excellent conversationalist, professional, and upbeat attitude consistently.
  • You MUST have a college degree in accounting (4 years)
  • You MUST have more than 2 years of public accounting (CPA Firm) experience
  • You must be fantastic with figuring out online/desktop software applications.
  • You must have a quiet room with a door, computer, and high-speed internet
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
  • Right-hand person to the founder with a mission to efficiently support new clients onboarding for bookkeeping services.
  • Take the phone calls scheduled with potential clients (all inbound and scheduled, never out-bound) and help them get started
  • Gather “getting started” items needed from new clients
  • Ability to clean up disastrous bookkeeping or start books from scratch for new clients
  • Light sales/marketing tasks
BONUS FUNCTIONS: (if you are an impressive candidate)
  • Marking/sales support
  • Streamline onboarding processes (find bottlenecks and develop solutions)
  • Develop client relationships
SOFTWARE APPLICATIONS YOU SHOULD KNOW:
  • QuickBooks Online (You will use this daily)
  • QuickBooks Desktop (we don’t use desktop often)
  • Microsoft Office (We use Office 365)
YOU WON’T BE DOING ANY OF THE FOLLOWING (below):
  • No Taxes… seriously, none.
  • A/R: we don’t do A/R or collections
  • Bill paying: we don’t offer any bill paying or check writing for our clients
  • Payroll: we don’t do payroll, but we assist clients by answering payroll questions and reconciling transactions to payroll reports.
WHAT TO SEND US:

Please send a resume with cover letter. The cover letter should not be a generic cover letter you send everyone. Make it specific to the job, and explain why you’d be the right candidate. Be yourself.

Apply to: careers@bookkeepingfordentists.com

BONUS:

We suggest creating a LinkedIn profile if you don’t have one. We give significant points for LinkedIn

Location: US Locations Only

International Finance Associate at Shield GEO

Remote | International
Finance Associate

Are you passionate about International Business, looking for flexibility in your career and craving creative freedom?

Then come join our team! We are looking for team-oriented, resourceful and self-motivated candidates.

Job Purpose: Finance Associate

Shield GEO provides outsourced employment and payroll for hundreds of employees in over 60 countries. Our Finance team is the engine that makes sure all our GEO employees get paid on time every month. They create invoices, process payments, generate payslips and resolve issues. The team collaborates closely with colleagues in Global Mobility, Subject Matter Experts and Implementation to ensure our clients have a great experience.

This is an administration heavy role as you’ll be creating many invoices and payslips every month. You’ll also be helping our internal teams with any questions they may have around international tax, payroll and finance. You’ll have plenty of support from our operational teams, systems and technology platform.

You will have the opportunity to work remotely and with flexible hours. You’ll also have the opportunity to advance your career in a young, growing company.

Working with Shield

If you are excited by the thought of playing an active role in a company that provides opportunities to create and innovate, you’re at the right place.

We’re a remote-friendly company with employees all around the world. We don’t want to be limited by location and are open to hiring anyone from anywhere – as long as it’s a great fit for us both. Before we get to know you, you might like to get an idea of who we are so you can decide if you want to be a part of what we’re about.

Every person is unique. At Shield GEO, we encourage an inclusive culture that embraces each individual’s differences. We believe that diversity of thought and experience is vital to generating creative ideas, developing effective strategies and making better decisions.

When hiring we do not discriminate by any unlawful means including, but not limited to, race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

We can’t quite show you what it’s like to work with us but you can hear from our employees themselves. Here’re some articles written by our Co-Founder, Customer Success Manager and Digital Marketing Manager.

  • Working remotely and flexibly with Shield Geo
  • Leave policy
  • Work equipment policy
  • Workplace Diversity policy
Do you share our values?

Our 4 values are integral to who we are. Our company culture is constantly evolving, every person who joins us adds something unique to our culture. But our values are shared by all Shield GEO employees. Do these values resonate with you?

Grow

We believe that personal growth and company growth go hand in hand. We look to foster our own growth and help grow the company. Every day is an opportunity to face a new challenge and get a little better. In our world of international employment it is impossible to know all the answers. Instead of trying to know everything, we focus on knowing how to solve problems. When mistakes happen we know it’s all part of the learning curve and we seek feedback to help us improve. We keep an eye on the big picture so we can identify improvements to processes and systems. As the problems become larger and more complex, it means that we’ll need more flexible and agile minds to come up with solutions.

Own It

We are self-motivated and love to see tasks to completion. Our managers and team mates are often in different time zones, and that’s ok! We aren’t afraid to step up when things get a little tough. We don’t like to micro-manage or be micromanaged. We trust our team mates to carry out their part of the process. We are responsible for our own workload and making sure we get our most important things done each day. If we get stuck we proactively seek help. And we show our reliability and accountability by keeping our systems updated. This also means our results can speak for themselves.

Do The Right Thing

Our clients trust us with compliance on their most important asset – their employees. This is a big responsibility! Doing the right thing means often times we choose a harder path and see it through to the end. It means we are open with our colleagues, clients and suppliers about bad news just the same as we share good news. And sometimes doing the right thing means we have to make decisions that will upset the very person we are trying to help. It’s a high standard but we stand by this very strongly. Doing the right thing also means considering how our actions impact those around us.

Be Human

We are a service business and helping people is at the core of everything we do. We pride ourselves on how we interact with colleagues, service providers and clients. We recognize that in all areas we’re dealing with real humans.
We know that working remotely and dealing with such a mix of people around the world is challenging. We know that if we are having trouble understanding someone, they are also struggling to understand us. Empathy is fundamental to helping us discover what people mean and how they are feeling. To avoid misinterpretation we assume best intent in others.
Because so much of our communication is written and asynchronous, we default to over-communication. This means we give extra details because we don’t leave people guessing. We make sure our words are clear and easy to understand. And we are kind to our fellow humans.

Your Background
  • At least two to three years’ experience within Finance
  • International tax or payroll experience strongly preferred. It will be helpful if you are familiar with concepts like employer social security, foreign exchange, gross ups and expense reimbursements.
  • Comfortable with technology. We are mostly remote and that means we rely on a bunch of applications to keep connected. That means video conferences (Zoom), chat and messaging (Slack, Skype and Salesforce Chatter), shared documents (Dropbox). You’ll likely be working by yourself during parts of your day without access to tech support.
  • Experience with Salesforce or Xero is helpful but not essential.
Essential Characteristics of this role
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to absorb information quickly.
  • Able to prioritize effectively and work autonomously while coordinating with an international team.
  • Exceptional attention to detail and maintaining accurate records.
  • Ideally located between UTC+3 and UTC+8 time zones
  • Some flexibility in working hours. We discourage overtime work and you will only be expected to work a standard number of hours each week. But we have clients and colleagues all over the world so sometimes you will need to be on calls in the morning or evening.
  • Request invoices from our providers located around the world
  • Create client invoices to cover the monthly payroll cost for each GEO employee
  • Request payslips from our providers around the work
  • Record and check payroll outputs within our systems to share with our clients
  • Record incoming payments and setup ongoing payments
  • Help to manage the team Accounts mailbox
  • Keep an accurate record of information in our internal systems by the process due dates
  • Check invoices for accuracy before sending to your clients
Responsibilities
Payroll and Invoicing
Process Improvement and Projects

Everyone at Shield gets involved in projects. These can range from a simple creation of a template to speed up a task through to creating complex automations which eliminate hours of admin work.

  • Assist the project team and other internal resources with recommending and implementing process and system improvements.
  • Act as a superuser in project teams
  • Help train other users when rolling out project solutions
  • Keep internal systems updated with progress on all core tasks
  • Weekly summary reporting
  • Ensure accuracy of all invoicing, payslip and payment data is entered in our internal CRM
Reporting
Next Steps

If you like what you’re read so far, this is a fantastic opportunity to join a global team committed to service. We’d really like to hear from you! Please keep your cover letter under 250 words and share with us what achievement you’re most proud of.

Be sure to submit your application quickly, as applications will close Thursday, 22 August, 11:59pm AoE!

Remote | International

Finance Associate

Are you passionate about International Business, looking for flexibility in your career and craving creative freedom?

Then come join our team! We are looking for team-oriented, resourceful and self-motivated candidates.

Job Purpose: Finance Associate

Shield GEO provides outsourced employment and payroll for hundreds of employees in over 60 countries. Our Finance team is the engine that makes sure all our GEO employees get paid on time every month. They create invoices, process payments, generate payslips and resolve issues. The team collaborates closely with colleagues in Global Mobility, Subject Matter Experts and Implementation to ensure our clients have a great experience.

This is an administration heavy role as you’ll be creating many invoices and payslips every month. You’ll also be helping our internal teams with any questions they may have around international tax, payroll and finance. You’ll have plenty of support from our operational teams, systems and technology platform.

You will have the opportunity to work remotely and with flexible hours. You’ll also have the opportunity to advance your career in a young, growing company.

Working with Shield

If you are excited by the thought of playing an active role in a company that provides opportunities to create and innovate, you’re at the right place.

We’re a remote-friendly company with employees all around the world. We don’t want to be limited by location and are open to hiring anyone from anywhere as long as it’s a great fit for us both. Before we get to know you, you might like to get an idea of who we are so you can decide if you want to be a part of what we’re about.

Every person is unique. At Shield GEO, we encourage an inclusive culture that embraces each individual’s differences. We believe that diversity of thought and experience is vital to generating creative ideas, developing effective strategies and making better decisions.

When hiring we do not discriminate by any unlawful means including, but not limited to, race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

Do you share our values?

Our 4 values are integral to who we are. Our company culture is constantly evolving, every person who joins us adds something unique to our culture. But our values are shared by all Shield GEO employees. Do these values resonate with you?

Grow

We believe that personal growth and company growth go hand in hand. We look to foster our own growth and help grow the company. Every day is an opportunity to face a new challenge and get a little better. In our world of international employment it is impossible to know all the answers. Instead of trying to know everything, we focus on knowing how to solve problems. When mistakes happen we know it’s all part of the learning curve and we seek feedback to help us improve. We keep an eye on the big picture so we can identify improvements to processes and systems. As the problems become larger and more complex, it means that we’ll need more flexible and agile minds to come up with solutions.

Own It

We are self-motivated and love to see tasks to completion. Our managers and teammates are often in different time zones, and that’s ok! We aren’t afraid to step up when things get a little tough. We don’t like to micro-manage or be micromanaged. We trust our teammates to carry out their part of the process. We are responsible for our own workload and making sure we get our most important things done each day. If we get stuck we proactively seek help. And we show our reliability and accountability by keeping our systems updated. This also means our results can speak for themselves.

Do The Right Thing

Our clients trust us with compliance on their most important asset – their employees. This is a big responsibility! Doing the right thing means often times we choose a harder path and see it through to the end. It means we are open with our colleagues, clients and suppliers about bad news just the same as we share good news. And sometimes doing the right thing means we have to make decisions that will upset the very person we are trying to help. It’s a high standard but we stand by this very strongly. Doing the right thing also means considering how our actions impact those around us.

Be Human

We are a service business and helping people is at the core of everything we do. We pride ourselves on how we interact with colleagues, service providers and clients. We recognize that in all areas we’re dealing with real humans. We know that working remotely and dealing with such a mix of people around the world is challenging. We know that if we are having trouble understanding someone, they are also struggling to understand us. Empathy is fundamental to helping us discover what people mean and how they are feeling. To avoid misinterpretation we assume best intent in others. Because so much of our communication is written and asynchronous, we default to over-communication. This means we give extra details because we don’t leave people guessing. We make sure our words are clear and easy to understand. And we are kind to our fellow humans.

Your Background

  • At least two to three years’ experience within Finance
  • International tax or payroll experience strongly preferred. It will be helpful if you are familiar with concepts like employer social security, foreign exchange, gross ups and expense reimbursements.
  • Comfortable with technology. We are mostly remote and that means we rely on a bunch of applications to keep connected. That means video conferences (Zoom), chat and messaging (Slack, Skype and Salesforce Chatter), shared documents (Dropbox). You’ll likely be working by yourself during parts of your day without access to tech support.
  • Experience with Salesforce or Xero is helpful but not essential.

Essential Characteristics of this role

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to absorb information quickly.
  • Able to prioritize effectively and work autonomously while coordinating with an international team.
  • Exceptional attention to detail and maintaining accurate records.
  • Ideally located between UTC+3 and UTC+8 time zones
  • Some flexibility in working hours. We discourage overtime work and you will only be expected to work a standard number of hours each week. But we have clients and colleagues all over the world so sometimes you will need to be on calls in the morning or evening.
  • Request invoices from our providers located around the world
  • Create client invoices to cover the monthly payroll cost for each GEO employee
  • Request payslips from our providers around the work
  • Record and check payroll outputs within our systems to share with our clients
  • Record incoming payments and setup ongoing payments
  • Help to manage the team Accounts mailbox
  • Keep an accurate record of information in our internal systems by the process due dates
  • Check invoices for accuracy before sending to your clients

Responsibilities

Payroll and Invoicing Process Improvement and Projects

Everyone at Shield gets involved in projects. These can range from a simple creation of a template to speed up a task through to creating complex automations which eliminate hours of admin work.

  • Assist the project team and other internal resources with recommending and implementing process and system improvements.
  • Act as a superuser in project teams
  • Help train other users when rolling out project solutions
  • Keep internal systems updated with progress on all core tasks
  • Weekly summary reporting
  • Ensure accuracy of all invoicing, payslip and payment data is entered in our internal CRM

We are seeking a Senior Accountant, Consolidation to join our rapidly growing accounting team in a truly global financial environment. This role will be distributed in the USA or Canada and we are focused on those currently located in PST or MST time zones.

The Senior Accountant works closely with other finance team staff as well as other Peerfit team members.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for month-end close duties. These duties include but not limited to: bank reconciliations, credit card reconciliations, payroll liability reconciliations, prepaid journal entries and reconciliations, bill.com reconciliations, preparation of financial statements, and other month end close research and reconciliations that may be needed. Understand the journal entries being made and why and review these respective sections for overall reasonableness.
  • Responsible for monthly revenue cycle invoicing and reporting. Ensure that clients are invoiced properly, revenue is recognized appropriately and in the proper period, monthly reports are reconciled to Looker, and any other duties that ensure proper revenue recognition.
  • Responsible for assisting Controller with budget process. These duties include but are not limited to: preparing and maintaining budget templates, gathering data through working with others, analyzing data to ensure reasonable, reconciling department roll-ups and loading approved budgets into accounting software.
  • Responsible for maintaining the equity accounting reporting. This includes and not limited to maintaining the awarded options reconciliation and vesting schedules as well as any other reconciliation and reports to provide proper equity accounting.
  • Responsible for expense report approvals and ensuring each expense has appropriate detail support which includes meeting IRS requirements, internal approvals, GL coding, and correct posting dates for accurate recording and integration into accounting software.
  • Responsible for understanding the payroll process and become the backup for such function in the case the payroll processor has scheduled PTO or emergencies. Ensure payroll entries and corresponding benefits are recorded accurately and timely. Reconcile payroll liability accounts and perform monthly accruals as necessary. Stay abreast of payroll compliance issues and concerns and alert management of any issues.
  • Responsible for ensuring bill.com payments are being processed timely and accurately. Review outstanding bills. Reconcile sync error report and reach out to appropriate team on how to resolve. Monitor expiring/expiring checks and work with appropriate team to resolve and document filing unclaimed property reports as necessary.
  • Responsible for daily bank activity review, matching of activity within QuickBooks, and journal entries as needed.
  • Responsible for preparing state compliance filings for payroll taxes, state taxes, sales tax and unclaimed property.
  • Responsible for year-end audit and tax preparation work, ensuring all financial information reconciles by account and state. Work closely with audit firm and Controller on providing timely and accurate information. Ensure records are maintained in an efficient manner to provide tax firm with organized and accurate financial information.
  • Responsible for year end 1099 reporting and documentation.
  • Responsible for ensuring accounting compliance and controls in accordance with GAAP, security/ privacy and HIPAA.
  • Organize permanent records in logical folders/ subfolders on Google Drive, ensuring all required documentation is saved timely with appropriate naming convention.
  • Provide positive support and training to junior accountant and administrative personnel that may or may not have accounting backgrounds.
  • Other duties as assigned.

EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelors in Accounting degree required
  • Minimum 5-year experience in a corporate accounting role required
  • Sales Tax Experience – Strongly preferred
  • CPA strongly preferred

WHO WE NEED: (Intangibles)

  • Passionate about health and fitness
  • Desires to have a role in the growth of a startup
  • Stays motivated and knows how to be persistent
  • Is self-directed
  • Can work remotely and make decisions autonomously at a high level
  • Flexibility to handle changing responsibilities

WHAT YOU GET:

  • The chance to work in a relaxed, yet goal-driven start-up culture with a passion for fitness
  • Peerfit credits to attend fitness classes.
